data.title: Friendly hostel in a great location
data.text: My husband and I stayed in the private room for 2 nights with our dog. It was wonderful finding a great place that is dog friendly. The self-check in process was easy and in fact the only people we interacted with were other guests. There was 1 full  and 1 1/2 bathroom so there was a wait to use the bathroom in the morning but that was expected. The hostel is right downtown and it was convenient to walk to coffee, dinner and the farmers market, we even walked back from a concert at Greenfield Lake Amphitheatre. Definitely will stay here again!

data.title: Great hostel
data.text: A very nice, and clean hostel.  The resident super, Max is great. I met nice people and made new friends. I will stay here again and highly recommend to others. This location is an easy commute into Wilmington or other neighboring communities and very accessible to walking to the Historic Downtown shops and night life.

data.title: Wonderful Location to Experience Historic Downtown Wilmington
data.text: The self check-in process was incredibly laid-back. Caretaker Max was there at when I arrived and was very welcoming and easy-going. This place had what was likely the cleanest refrigerator that I've yet seen at a hostel, and tape was conveniently located to label your items. What I liked most about my stay though was the location of this hostel.  It is so conveniently situated in historic downtown Wilmington, right across from the draw bridge and only one block back from the Cape Fear River. I enjoyed being surrounded by true Wilmington, NC character and historic architecture. I will certainly be considering another stay when I return to Wilmington.

data.title: Love this place
data.text:
this hostel is right in the middle of the historic district, so walkable to the riverfront, downtown and if you like to see homes from the 1800's, this is the place. 

Breakfast items are provided and there's a full kitchen and seating to create your meal and enjoy it. If you like to meet international travelers, this is a fun way to do that. I met 2 Germans and a New Zealander. Clean hostel and cute front porch with seating. I would like to return.

data.title: Cozy and Clean
data.text:
This is one of the cleanest hostels I've ever stayed at by far. The kitchen, bathroom, and bedrooms are immaculate, and everything is clearly labeled. The hostel itself is charming and there's even a separate living area in the back with couches and a table for eating or socializing. It's location is ideal, too. 

The staff was friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend.

data.title: Great Location for Price
data.text:
Rented the private room. There were two of us staying in there and it was comfortable. Free parking across the street. Prime location to downtown. 

Didn't socialize in the house with the other guests but didn't feel awkward about it. You can be as social or non as you'd like - which is a plus.  Everyone we met was friendly.

Max the overseer was chill and friendly.

Bathrooms were clean. They had clean towels for us to use. The bed was really comfy - I think it was memory foam.

Clean sheets.

The private room had a key so we could lock the door when we left. That was nice.

Free and reliable wi-fi was included.

data.title: Too quiet for a solo traveller
data.text: As a solo traveller I came knowing no one and when I arrived at the hostel there was no one in site not even staff. In an unfamiliar town I felt a little secluded not knowing anyone or what to see. Probably better for groups that have a car to go other places. Place was clean and neat and Bess were comfy but I didn't really feel right being a solo traveller.
